Fun game, played the coop with my 8 year old son.  Single player pretty fun too, cant believe i haven't played it before.

[b] THIS DOES CONTAIN SOME GAMEPLAY ELEMENTS THAT MIGHT BE CONSIDERED SPOILERS; I'VE KEPT IT CLEAN WHEN TALKING ABOUT THE STORY HOWEVER [/b]

I first learnt about the game when I was pretty young. I'm somewhat older now and having known this game for a very good chunk of my life it's safe to say that this game has earned its place in the hall of fame.

GRAPHICS:
For a 2011 game it holds up surprisingly well. Lighting is good, textures are decent, and the facility just overall looks great even around a decade later.

GAMEPLAY:
It's pretty much the original Portal, with some new additions and tweaks to the gameplay to keep it fresh.
You have the core gameplay coming with with cubes + buttons, "the floor is lava"-like toxic goo, and of course, portals.

You also have some new additions as well, such as lasers (well, sort of; it's more of a successor to the energy pellet from the last game which has been removed) and the mobility gels (allowing you to bounce, slide, and create your own portal surfaces respectively), bringing in new ways to design tests and keep it overall really fun and interesting to play.

The last boss is okay-ish. Dialogue-wise it's great, it has a good buildup, and an absolute banger of a soundtrack but it honestly feels a tad-bit underwhelming. The first game also had this issue.

STORY:
It's... it's just great, I mean, you have that Valve™️ style quality that most of their games have. The story is fun to listen to with believable voice acting and humorous dialogue, making the game an absolute pleasure to go through every time. Each character has their own charm and they all feel unique and fun.

CONTENT:
If we're talking about the base game, it's pretty short. You're looking at about a handful of hours in terms of singleplayer campaign and another handful with multiplayer. However, you do also have the Steam Workshop which is nice since you'll pretty much have a lot of content to solve puzzles (and even sometimes explore new stories too!).

Oh, right- The multiplayer!

MULTIPLAYER:
So, the game does actually have a separate campaign specifically for multiplayer; unfortunately, I've never actually finished it and only gotten to the fifth course. All of my previous praise applies here, however.

There's still the same old charm that the story brings, the fun and brain-testing gameplay (with the now added complexity as you try to work with your partner but only end up ruining a friendship), and the overall fun experience it brings to the game. I've played it with multiple people and it's been pretty fun to go through it with each person (although sadly I have still to actually beat it, as stated before).

OVERALL:
It's Portal 2. It's fun, humorous, gets your brain working, and a great successor to the first game.
A definite recommend.

Fabuła gry zawiązuje się tuż po wydarzeniach, których świadkami byliśmy w części pierwszej. Nasza podopieczna, wydostaje się z ośrodka w którym była przetrzymywana, ale po finałowej potyczce traci świadomość. Chwilę później nieprzytomna kobieta zostaje zaciągnięta przez robota do jednego z pokojów . Chell staje na nogi po długim śnie i z przerażeniem obserwuje, że świat wokół niej zmienił się nie do poznania. Przytulny niegdyś pokój na sam widok nie przypomina pokoju wypoczynkowego a utrzymana dawniej w doskonałym stanie placówka badawcza jest teraz zarośnięta. Na prośbę przybyłego w tym samym momencie robota, kobieta ucieka z rozsypującego się mieszkania i rozpoczyna  wędrówkę przez zrujnowany kompleks.. Zabawa sprowadza się w głównej mierze do pokonywania kolejnych komór testowych, gdzie na bohaterkę gry czekają konkretne wyzwania. Znalezienie drogi do wyjścia z danej lokacji nie zawsze jest proste, pomieszczenia testowe wymagają więcej myślenia niż ostatnim razem w części poprzedniej zanim uda się wpaść na pomysł, jak uporać się z napotkanym problemem. Przed premierą liczyłem na to, że tym razem autorzy dadzą graczom nieco więcej swobody i umożliwią zaliczenie niektórych testów na kilka różnych sposobów jednak tak się też nie stało.

MÜTHİŞ BİR OYUN!!!
******************
Artıları:
-Oyunun hikayesi çok sarıcı
-Kesinlikle kafa çalıştıran bi oyun
-Sistem gereksinimlerine göre muhteşem grafiği var
-Oyunun üzerine kurulmuş olduğu portallarla bölümleri geçmek bence çok eğşenceli
-Oyun içinde pek hata yok. Yani bir yere sıkışıp oyunu kaydetmeden çıkmanıza gerek kalmıyo
*******************
Eksileri:
-Hikaye modu bana biraz kısa geldi.

Şuan bi saçmalık edip bu oyunu 1. oyununu oynadamdan oynadım ama 1. oyunun konusunuda anladım 2. oyun sayesinde. 
1.oynu oynamama rapmen çok güzel geldi.

Baktığım kadarıyla hikaye bitince oyun bitmiyor. Sonradan başkalarının odaları arkadaşınızla veya kendiniz yapabilir vrya ben bu oyunun üstadı oldum deyip zor bir oda hazırlamaya çalışabilirsiniz.

OYUN 5 ÜZERİNDEN 4.7 OYNANIR BENCE

Myślałam, że dwójka do oryginalnego majstersztyku mnie zawiedzie, po czym było mi głupio, bo jest jeszcze lepsza. Wszystko jest ulepszone: grafika, projekty pomieszczeń, mechaniki, satysfakcja z rozwiązania problemu, a przede wszystkim fabuła, która pomimo wykorzystania elementów z oryginału była równie zaskakująca. Plus wyjątkowe rozbudowanie uniwersum i błyskotliwe wykorzystanie wątków pobocznych w kulminacji gry. Tak się robi moje ulubione gry.
